subject: PHYSICS
summary: This lesson will introduce students to different types of energy stores, energy transfer mechanisms, and the concepts of open and closed systems, along with the meaning of work done.
contentItems: The different types of energy store.
The different ways energy can be transferred.
learningObjectives: Understand and identify different types of energy stores.
Explain how energy can be transferred between systems.
Distinguish between open and closed systems.
Define and apply the concept of work done.

starter.activity: Quick quiz on energy types using flashcards.

mainActivities.activity: Group work: Students create a mind map showing different energy stores and how they transfer energy.
Class discussion on open vs closed systems with examples from everyday life.
Interactive demonstration of 'work done' using weights and a pulley system.

plenary.activity: Recap key concepts with a Q&A session and summarize the main points of the lesson.

assessmentMethods: Exit ticket: Students write one thing they learned and one question they still have.

homework.task: Complete the worksheet on energy stores and systems, including definitions and examples.

teacherNotes: Ensure that all materials are prepared in advance. Check the projector and presentation for any technical issues before the lesson.
